div1.head: Letter from William H. Forwood to the Adjutant General, September 5, 1901
div1.opener:
Communications on official business should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Detail Medical Officer, Amer. Public Health Assc.
In reply refer to No.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
Washington, September 5, 1901.
A. C. P. DIVISION,
A. G. O.
SEP
5
1901
To the
Adjutant General, U.S. Army.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to recommend that Major Walter Reed,
Surgeon, U.S. Army, this city, be detailed as an additional of-
ficer to represent the Medical Department of the Army at the an-
nual meeting of the American Public Health Association to be
held at Buffalo, New York, September 16th to 20, 1901.

It is requested that Major Reed proceed from this city
in time to reach Buffalo, N. Y. on or before the 16th of Sep-
tember, and that upon the adjournment of the Association he re-
turn to his station in this city.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, W. H. Forwood Assistant Surgeon General, U.S. Army,
Acting Surgeon General.

div1.head: Special Orders #207, September 5, 1901
div1.p: TO BE RETAINED WITH PAPERS

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 207. }

HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, September 5, 1901.
Extract.

12. By direction of the Acting Secretary of War, Major
Walter Reed, surgeon U. S. Army, is detailed as an additional
officer to represent the Medical Department of the Army at
the annual meeting of the American Public Health Associa-
tion to be held at Buffalo, New York, September 16 to 20, 1901.
Major Reed will proceed from this city in time to reach Buf-
falo, New York, on or before September 16, 1901, and upon
the adjournment of the association will return to his station
in this city. The travel enjoined is necessary for the public
service.
BY COMMAND OF LIEUTENANT GENERAL MILES:

THOMAS WARD,
Acting Adjutant General.
